intro: Eritrichium huzhuense, commonly known as the Huzhu hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau in China. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. It has lance-shaped leaves with a fuzzy texture and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
